qas.question: Who was The Times' Chief Editor in 1914?
The Chief Editor of The Times in 1914 argued that the British Empire should enter what war?
What anti-Semitic fabrication did The Times endorse in 1920?

answers.text: The Protocols of the Learned Elders of Zion

qas.question: After publishing anti-Semitic editorials in 1920, what did The Times refer to Jews as being?
What was the name of the anti-Semitic article that The Time's Chief Editor published in 1914?

answers.text: The Jewish Peril, a Disturbing Pamphlet: Call for Inquiry

context: In editorials published on 29 and 31 July 1914, <a0_0>Wickham Steed<a0_0/>, the Times's Chief Editor, argued that the British Empire should enter <a1_0>World War I<a1_0/>. On 8 May 1920, also under the editorship of Steed, The Times in an editorial endorsed the anti-Semitic fabrication <a2_0>The Protocols of the Learned Elders of Zion<a2_0/> as a genuine document, and called Jews <a3_0>the world's greatest danger<a3_0/>. In the leader entitled "<a4_0>The Jewish Peril, a Disturbing Pamphlet: Call for Inquiry<a4_0/>", Steed wrote about The Protocols of the Elders of Zion:
